text: Talk is cheap. Show me the code.
author: Linus Torvalds

text: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
author: Harold Abelson

text: Any fool can write code that a computer can understand. Good programmers write code that humans can understand.
author: Martin Fowler

text: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

text: Experience is the name everyone gives to their mistakes.
author: Oscar Wilde

text: Java is to JavaScript what car is to Carpet.
author: Chris Heilmann

text: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday’s code.
author: Dan Salomon

text: Perfection is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but rather when there is nothing more to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

text: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.
author: Cory House

text: Fix the cause, not the symptom.
author: Steve Maguire

text: Optimism is an occupational hazard of programming: feedback is the treatment.
author: Kent Beck

text: Simplicity is the soul of efficiency.
author: Austin Freeman

text: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.
author: Ralph Johnson

text: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
author: Kent Beck

text: Clean code always looks like it was written by someone who cares.
author: Robert C. Martin

text: Programming isn't about what you know; it's about what you can figure out.
author: Chris Pine

text: The only valid measurement of code quality: WTFs/minute.
author: Thom Holwerda

text: Deleted code is debugged code.
author: Jeff Sickel

text: One of my most productive days was throwing away 1000 lines of code.
author: Ken Thompson

text: Systematic debugging: Wait for the bug to go away.
author: Anonymous

text: Confusion is part of programming.
author: Felienne Hermans

text: A good programmer is someone who always looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.
author: Doug Linder

text: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
author: Bill Gates

text: There are two hard things in computer science: cache invalidation, naming things, and off-by-one errors.
author: Leon Bambrick

text: The function of good software is to make the complex appear to be simple.
author: Grady Booch

text: Debugging is twice as hard as writing the code in the first place. Therefore, if you write the code as cleverly as possible, you are, by definition, not smart enough to debug it.
author: Brian Kernighan

text: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
author: Edward V Berard

text: It's not a bug – it's an undocumented feature.
author: Anonymous

text: Software undergoes beta testing shortly before it’s released. Beta is Latin for 'still doesn’t work'.
author: Anonymous

text: Programming is 10% writing code and 90% understanding why it’s not working.
author: Anonymous

text: If debugging is the process of removing software bugs, then programming must be the process of putting them in.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

text: There is always one more bug.
author: Lubarsky's Law

text: Code never lies, comments sometimes do.
author: Ron Jeffries

text: Real programmers don't comment their code. If it was hard to write, it should be hard to understand.
author: Anonymous

text: The computer was born to solve problems that did not exist before.
author: Bill Gates

text: Software is eating the world.
author: Marc Andreessen

text: Every great developer you know got there by solving problems they were unqualified to solve until they actually did it.
author: Patrick McKenzie

text: Don't comment bad code - rewrite it.
author: Brian Kernighan

text: A language that doesn't affect the way you think about programming, is not worth knowing.
author: Alan Perlis

text: The most damaging phrase in the language is 'It's always been done this way'.
author: Grace Hopper

text: I'm not a great programmer; I'm just a good programmer with great habits.
author: Kent Beck

text: Truth can only be found in one place: the code.
author: Robert C. Martin

text: That's the thing about people who think they hate computers. What they really hate is lousy programmers.
author: Larry Niven

text: Simplicity is the ultimate sophistication.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

text: Testing leads to failure, and failure leads to understanding.
author: Burt Rutan

text: Don't worry if it doesn't work right. If everything did, you'd be out of a job.
author: Mosher's Law

text: There are only two kinds of languages: the ones people complain about and the ones nobody uses.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

text: Premature optimization is the root of all evil.
author: Donald Knuth

text: No one in the brief history of computing has ever written a piece of perfect software. It's unlikely that you'll be the first.
author: Andy Hunt

text: The most important property of a program is whether it accomplishes the intention of its user.
author: C.A.R. Hoare

text: Good design adds value faster than it adds cost.
author: Thomas C. Gale

text: The proper use of comments is to compensate for our failure to express ourself in code.
author: Robert C. Martin

text: A user interface is like a joke. If you have to explain it, it's not that good.
author: Martin LeBlanc

text: Before you software can be reusable it first has to be usable.
author: Ralph Johnson

text: First learn computer science and all the theory. Next develop a programming style. Then forget all that and just hack.
author: George Carrette

text: It’s all talk until the code runs.
author: Ward Cunningham

text: Computer science education cannot make anybody an expert programmer any more than studying brushes and pigment can make somebody an expert painter.
author: Eric S. Raymond

text: Most good programmers do programming not because they expect to get paid or get adulation by the public, but because it is fun to program.
author: Linus Torvalds

text: Design is not just what it looks like and feels like. Design is how it works.
author: Steve Jobs

text: We cannot solve our problems with the same thinking we used when we created them.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Everything should be made as simple as possible, but not simpler.
author: Albert Einstein

text: Insanity: doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.
author: Albert Einstein

text: If you can't explain it to a six year old, you don't understand it yourself.
author: Albert Einstein

text: The question of whether computers can think is like the question of whether submarines can swim.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

text: When debugging, novices insert corrective code; experts remove defective code.
author: Richard Pattis

text: Users don't know what they want until they see it.
author: Steve Jobs

text: The only way to go fast, is to go well.
author: Robert C. Martin

text: So much complexity in software comes from trying to make one thing do two things.
author: Ryan Singer

text: Prolific developers don't always write a lot of code, instead they solve a lot of problems. The two things are not the same.
author: J. Chambers

text: The best way to predict the future is to implement it.
author: David Heinemeier Hansson

text: Programming is the art of telling another human what one wants the computer to do.
author: Donald Knuth

text: Without requirements or design, programming is the art of adding bugs to an empty text file.
author: Louis Srygley

text: Walking on water and developing software from a specification are easy if both are frozen.
author: Edward V. Berard

text: A code that cannot be tested is flawed.
author: Anonymous

text: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: John Woods

text: The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what a programmer is doing until it's too late.
author: Seymour Cray

text: It works on my machine.
author: Anonymous

text: Programming today is a race between software engineers striving to build bigger and better idiot-proof programs, and the Universe trying to produce bigger and better idiots. So far, the Universe is winning.
author: Rick Cook

text: Any code of your own that you haven't looked at for six or more months might as well have been written by someone else.
author: Eagleson's Law

text: Software efficiency halves every 18 months, compensating Moore's Law.
author: May's Law

text: 90% of the functionality delivered now is better than 100% of it delivered never.
author: Kernighan & Plauger

text: If builders built buildings the way programmers wrote programs, then the first woodpecker that came along would destroy civilization.
author: Gerald Weinberg

text: The first 90% of the code accounts for the first 90% of the development time. The remaining 10% of the code accounts for the other 90% of the development time.
author: Tom Cargill

text: In order to understand recursion, one must first understand recursion.
author: Anonymous

text: I have always found that plans are useless, but planning is indispensable.
author: Dwight D. Eisenhower

text: It is better to wait for a productive programmer to become available than it is to wait for the first available programmer to become productive.
author: Steve McConnell

text: We should forget about small efficiencies, say about 97% of the time: premature optimization is the root of all evil.
author: Donald Knuth

text: The cheapest, fastest, and most reliable components are those that aren't there.
author: Gordon Bell

text: Don't document the problem, fix it.
author: Atli Björgvin Oddsson

text: As soon as we started programming, we found to our surprise that it wasn't as easy to get programs right as we had thought. Debugging had to be discovered. I can remember the exact instant when I realized that a large part of my life from then on was going to be spent in finding mistakes in my own programs.
author: Maurice Wilkes

text: What one programmer can do in one month, two programmers can do in two months.
author: Fred Brooks

text: Good code is its own best documentation. As you're about to add a comment, ask yourself, 'How can I improve the code so that this comment isn't needed?'
author: Steve McConnell

text: Every good work of software starts by scratching a developer's personal itch.
author: Eric S. Raymond

text: Perfection (in design) is achieved not when there is nothing more to add, but rather when there is nothing more to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

text: Ruby is rubbish! PHP is phpantastic!
author: Nikita Popov

text: Code generation, like drinking alcohol, is good in moderation.
author: Alex Lowe

text: Programming is like kicking yourself in the face, sooner or later your nose will bleed.
author: Kyle Woodbury

text: If you automate a mess, you get an automated mess.
author: Rod Michael

text: The code you write makes you a programmer. The code you delete makes you a good one. The code you don't have to write makes you a great one.
author: Mario Fusco

text: Debugging is like being the detective in a crime movie where you are also the murderer.
author: Filipe Fortes

text: Linux is only free if your time has no value.
author: Jamie Zawinski

text: Documentation is like sex: when it is good, it is very, very good; and when it is bad, it is better than nothing.
author: Dick Brandon

text: Programming is similar to a game of golf. The point is not to get the ball in the hole but how many strokes it takes.
author: Harlan Mills

text: A computer program does what you tell it to do, not what you want it to do.
author: Arthur Bloch

text: The best performance improvement is the transition from the nonworking state to the working state.
author: J. Osterhout

text: It is easier to change the specification to fit the program than vice versa.
author: Alan Perlis

text: If you think your users are idiots, only idiots will use it.
author: Linus Torvalds

text: Low-level programming is good for the programmer's soul.
author: John Carmack

text: Learning to write programs stretches your mind, and helps you think better, creates a way of thinking about things that is helpful in all domains.
author: Bill Gates

text: The use of COBOL cripples the mind; its teaching should, therefore, be regarded as a criminal offense.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

text: Lisp isn't a language, it's a building material.
author: Alan Kay

text: C makes it easy to shoot yourself in the foot; C++ makes it harder, but when you do, it blows your whole leg off.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

text: Java is C++ without the guns, clubs, and knives.
author: James Gosling

text: Python is executable pseudocode. Perl is executable line noise.
author: Bruce Eckel

text: In C++ it's harder to shoot yourself in the foot, but when you do, you blow off your whole leg.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

text: I think Microsoft named .Net so it wouldn't show up in a Unix directory listing.
author: Oktal

text: Software is like entropy: It is difficult to grasp, weighs nothing, and obeys the Second Law of Thermodynamics; i.e., it always increases.
author: Norman Augustine

text: Controlling complexity is the essence of computer programming.
author: Brian Kernighan

text: It is always easier to apologize than it is to get permission.
author: Grace Hopper

text: The best method for accelerating a computer is the one that boosts it by 9.8 m/s2.
author: Anonymous

text: I don't care if it works on your machine! We are not shipping your machine!
author: Vidiu Platon

text: Programming is not about typing, it's about thinking.
author: Rich Hickey

text: If you can't write it down in English, you can't code it.
author: Peter Halpern

text: Any sufficiently advanced technology is indistinguishable from magic.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

text: You can't have great software without a great team, and most software teams behave like dysfunctional families.
author: Jim McCarthy

text: The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it.
author: Dennis Ritchie

text: When in doubt, use brute force.
author: Ken Thompson

text: Before you can be a good programmer, you must first be a programmer.
author: Anonymous

text: A computer lets you make more mistakes faster than any invention in human history - with the possible exceptions of handguns and tequila.
author: Mitch Ratcliffe

text: The hardest part of design is keeping features out.
author: Donald Norman

text: Programming is the art of doing one thing at a time
author: Michael Jackson

text: One man's crappy software is another man's full time job.
author: Jessica Gaston

text: Without requirements or design, programming is the art of adding bugs to an empty text file.
author: Louis Srygley

text: The best code is no code at all.
author: Jeff Atwood

text: Measuring programming progress by lines of code is like measuring aircraft building progress by weight.
author: Bill Gates

text: To understand recursion, you must first understand recursion.
author: Anonymous

text: It works on my machine.
author: Anonymous

text: Coding is not just code, that is a fallacy. Coding is a living breathing thing; it is an art.
author: Rosalyn Carter

text: Most software today is very like an Egyptian pyramid with millions of bricks piled on top of each other, with no structural integrity, but just done by brute force and thousands of slaves.
author: Alan Kay

text: First, solve the problem. Then, write the code.
author: John Johnson

text: Code is read much more often than it is written.
author: Guido van Rossum

text: If you're good at the debugger it means you spent a lot of time debugging. I don't want you to be good at the debugger.
author: Robert C. Martin

text: The most disastrous thing that you can ever learn is your first programming language.
author: Alan Kay

text: The computer is a moron.
author: Peter Drucker

text: Programming is the only job I can think of where I get to be both an engineer and an artist. There's an incredible, rigorous, technical element to it, which I like because you have to do very precise thinking. On the other hand, it has a wildly creative side where the boundaries of imagination are the only real limitation.
author: Andy Hertzfeld

text: If you lie to the computer, it will get you.
author: Perryiar

text: The gap between theory and practice is smaller in theory than it is in practice.
author: Yogi Berra

text: Weeks of coding can save you hours of planning.
author: Anonymous

text: I love deadlines. I like the whooshing sound they make as they fly by.
author: Douglas Adams

text: Hardware: The parts of a computer system that can be kicked.
author: Jeff Pesis

text: There are 10 types of people in the world: those who understand binary, and those who don't.
author: Anonymous

text: Writing code has a place in the human hierarchy of worth somewhere above grave robbing and beneath managing.
author: Gerald Weinberg

text: A program is never less than 90% complete, and never more than 95% complete.
author: Terry Baker

text: Programming is easy like riding a bike. Except the bike is on fire. You are on fire. Everything is on fire. And you are in hell.
author: Anonymous

text: Copy-and-Paste was programmed by programmers for programmers actually.
author: Anonymous

text: Always code as if the guy who ends up maintaining your code will be a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: Martin Golding

text: In a room full of top software designers, if two agree on the same thing, that's a majority.
author: Bill Curtis

text: One broken window starts the process toward decay.
author: Andy Hunt

text: It’s hard enough to find an error in your code when you’re looking for it; it’s even harder when you’ve assumed your code is error-free.
author: Steve McConnell

text: Good programmers know what to write. Great ones know what to rewrite (and reuse).
author: Eric S. Raymond

text: Every programmer is an author.
author: Sercan Leylek

text: A good programmer is someone who looks both ways before crossing a one-way street.
author: Doug Linder

text: Don't worry about people stealing your design. If it's any good, you'll have to ram it down their throats.
author: Howard Aiken

text: Math is the only place where truth and beauty are the same thing.
author: Danica McKellar

text: The only way to learn a new programming language is by writing programs in it.
author: Dennis Ritchie

text: Sometimes it pays to stay in bed on Monday, rather than spending the rest of the week debugging Monday's code.
author: Christopher Thompson

text: Ruby is rubbish! PHP is phpantastic!
author: Nikita Popov

text: Code is like humor. When you have to explain it, it’s bad.
author: Cory House

text: Before software can be reusable it first has to be usable.
author: Ralph Johnson

text: Make it work, make it right, make it fast.
author: Kent Beck

text: In programming, the hard part isn't solving problems, but deciding what problems to solve.
author: Paul Graham

text: The value of a prototype is in the education it gives you, not in the code itself.
author: Alan Cooper

text: The goal of Computer Science is to build something that will last at least until we've finished building it.
author: Anonymous

text: If you give someone a program, you will frustrate them for a day; if you teach them how to program, you will frustrate them for a lifetime.
author: David Leinweber

text: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas Edison

text: It is not enough for code to work.
author: Robert C. Martin

text: The major difference between a thing that might go wrong and a thing that cannot possibly go wrong is that when a thing that cannot possibly go wrong goes wrong it usually turns out to be impossible to get at or repair.
author: Douglas Adams

text: Any code that you haven't looked at for six months or more might as well have been written by someone else.
author: Eagleson's Law

text: Unix is user-friendly. It just isn't promiscuous about which users it's friendly with.
author: Steven King

text: The most important thing in the programming language is the name. A language will not succeed without a good name. I have recently invented a very good name and now I am looking for a suitable language.
author: Donald Knuth

text: Programming is not a science. Programming is a craft.
author: Richard Stallman

text: Don't comment bad code - rewrite it.
author: Brian Kernighan

text: There are only two kinds of programming languages: those people always complain about and those nobody uses.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

text: The trouble with programmers is that you can never tell what a programmer is doing until it’s too late.
author: Seymour Cray

text: Most software today is very like an Egyptian pyramid with millions of bricks piled on top of each other, with no structural integrity, but just done by brute force and thousands of slaves.
author: Alan Kay

text: You cannot teach beginners top-down programming, because they don't know which end is up.
author: C.A.R. Hoare

text: In the long run every program becomes rotted rubbish.
author: Fred Brooks

text: Beware of bugs in the above code; I have only proved it correct, not tried it.
author: Donald Knuth

text: Simplicity is prerequisite for reliability.
author: Edsger W. Dijkstra

text: A good programmer works with his brain, not his fingers.
author: Anonymous

text: When you don't create things, you become defined by your tastes rather than ability. your tastes only narrow & exclude people. so create.
author: why the lucky stiff

text: Programs must be written for people to read, and only incidentally for machines to execute.
author: Abelson & Sussman

text: Programming can be fun, so can cryptography; however they should not be combined.
author: Kreitzberg & Shneiderman

text: If you want to set off and go develop some grand new thing, you don't need millions of dollars of capitalization. You need enough pizza and Diet Coke to stick in your refrigerator, a cheap PC to work on and the dedication to go through with it.
author: John Carmack

text: One of the best programming skills you can have is knowing when to walk away for a while.
author: Oscar Godson

text: Without requirements or design, programming is the art of adding bugs to an empty text file.
author: Louis Srygley

text: Java is to JavaScript what Car is to Carpet.
author: Chris Heilmann

text: It's better to wait for a productive programmer to become available than it is to wait for the first available programmer to become productive.
author: Steve McConnell

text: Think twice, code once.
author: Anonymous

text: We build our computer (systems) the way we build our cities: over time, without a plan, on top of ruins.
author: Ellen Ullman

text: What is the difference between a programmer and a non-programmer? The programmer knows that it doesn't work.
author: Anonymous

text: Every piece of software written today is likely going to be maintained for life.
author: Anonymous

text: The only way to write bug-free code is to write no code at all.
author: Anonymous

text: Programming is the art of algorithm design and the craft of debugging errant code.
author: Ellen Ullman

text: Fools ignore complexity. Pragmatists suffer it. Some can avoid it. Geniuses remove it.
author: Alan Perlis

text: The most important single aspect of software development is to be clear about what you are trying to build.
author: Bjarne Stroustrup

text: Good programmers use their brains, but good guidelines save us having to use them in every case.
author: Francis Glassborow

text: If you can't write it down in English, you can't code it.
author: Peter Halpern

text: Any code that you haven't looked at for six months or more might as well have been written by someone else.
author: Eagleson's Law

text: Programmers are not to be measured by their ingenuity and their logic but by the completeness of their case analysis.
author: Alan Perlis
